title.rendered: How to Get Minecraft on Windows 11/10 – Free or Paid Version

content.rendered:
In this guide, we’ll discuss what are the ways to get Minecraft on Windows 11 or 10 PC, the different editions it provides for beginners, and how to activate them.

Minecraft started its journey with a very small game, just like Mario. Gameplay used to be pretty simple i.e. build your house and keep going. Nowadays, it has completely transformed into an advanced line of games that come under different names, each offering unique gameplay.

Minecraft has now become a huge 3D world where users can build, craft, mine, fight and explore different things. However, before you figure out what this game is all about, you must first know how to get Minecraft games on your device.

You may also like: If you already have a Minecraft game on your computer, read this article on how to update it regularly.

Get Minecraft on Windows 11/10 – Free or Paid

Before you can play Minecraft games on your PC, you must first decide which editions you really want to go for. There are basically two editions you can choose from. The two commonly played editions of Minecraft are as follows:

  • Java edition
  • Bedrock edition

If this is your first time hearing them, here is a detailed description of each of them –

Minecraft Java Edition

The Java Edition is the oldest of any game type ever to appear in Minecraft and is still available for Windows, macOS, or Linux. Installing this edition will give you better graphics, more servers and unlimited modding possibilities. The only downside of this version is that you cannot play this game on mobile, console or other similar devices. However, you can play with computers, i.e. all other online players, via Windows, Linux or macOS.

How to play classic minecraft games in web browser

Minecraft Bed Rock Edition

Bedrock Edition is more of an enhanced version and is commonly known as Minecraft for Windows 10. Users prefer this edition because it can play on multiple operating systems, e.g. Windows, Xbox, Android, iOS, etc. When it comes to performance or utilization times, it also beats the Java edition. But that’s because it doesn’t have a hardcore or spectator mode. If you want to create custom mods, this option is only available in Java edition.

Now that you know the fundamental differences between these two editions, choose the Minecraft version wisely. If you want to play this game with your friends, you can’t decide that alone. Keep in mind that you cannot cross play these two editions. So better discuss in a group of friends and come to an agreement.

1]Get Minecraft Bedrock Edition on Windows 11/10

As mentioned above, this type of game is specific to Windows operating systems, you can easily get it through the Microsoft Store. Follow the steps below to download/install this edition of Minecraft:

  • Launch the Windows Store app by tapping the icon on the taskbar.
  • When it opens, go to the search bar and type “Minecraft“. A list of matching Minecraft games will appear in the search results. However, most of them either require a Game Pass or display a price tag.
  • Select the versions that offer a trial version. For example: Click on the option – Minecraft for Windows 10.
  • You may find a free trial option just below the price. Click on it and wait for this game to download and install.
  • Since the size of this game is around 450+ MB, it will take some time to download or install on your computer.

  • After this game has been installed successfully, click the play.

That’s it, you now own the bedrock edition of Minecraft. Open this game on your computer and enjoy the gameplay.

2]Get Bedrock Edition from Minecraft website

Alternatively, you can also download this game by visiting the official website, e.g. www.minecraft.net. If you want a detailed description follow the guide below –

  • First, visit the Minecraft official website and click on it Get Minecraft.

  • When asked how you would like to play, select one of the available options. This includes – computer, mobile device, console and others.

  • If you select mobile or console, you won’t get an option to install Minecraft Java Edition.
  • Follow the on-screen instructions and you’ll be presented with a handful of editions to choose from.
  • Select the game you want to continue, buy it and then only you can play this game on your selected device.

If you want to try a Minecraft game first, follow this guideline instead –

  • Visit the Minecraft website again, hover over Games and click Minecraft.
  • If you choose another game, you will have to buy that one.
  • Next to the Download Minecraft option, click TRY FOR FREE.

  • On the next screen, select your operating system. If you choose the Windows option, you will be redirected to the Microsoft Store page.
  • Click Free Trial, sign in to your Microsoft account and you will be redirected to the Windows Store app again.
  • That’s it, you can now follow the exact steps explained in the section above.

3]Download and install the Minecraft game with an installer

You can also install the Minecraft game free trial version with an installer. Follow the steps below to download the executable file:

  • Open your web browser and copy the following URL into the address bar –

www.minecraft.net/en-us/free-trial

  • Press Enter to fully load the webpage. If so, click DownloadNow.
  • This will prompt you to download the installer, continue and save the setup file.
  • After the installer has downloaded, double click on it to begin the installation.

  • Follow the on-screen instructions one by one and this is how you will get the Minecraft game.

That’s it, I hope you enjoy the Minecraft free trial and upgrade soon to enjoy the premium features.
